Resolved Issues for the Windows Vista Operating System 
 
This section provides information on resolved issues in this release of the ATI CatalystÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¾Ã‚Â¢ Software Suite for Windows Vista.

These include: 
 
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  "World of Warcraft" or "World of Warcraft - Wrath of the Lich King": Flickering no longer occurs when Shadow is set to medium/high using CrossFire 

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Google Sketchup no longer displays blank screen 

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Resolutions above 10 x 7 will now full screen properly for specific HDMI displays 

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Artifacts no longer visible while playing Age of Conan DX10 

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  VC-1 progressive disc playback no longer exhibits block corruption

This section provides information on resolved issues in this release of the ATI CatalystÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¾Ã‚Â¢ Software Suite for Windows 7.

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  City of Villains: Display now redraws correctly after changing graphics settings

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  WinDVD9 HD playback doesn't cause the desktop to jitter or flicker anymore 

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Device Manager no longer displays error during express driver uninstall 


Known Issues Under the Windows Vista Operating System 
 
This section provides information on known issues that may be experienced under the Windows Vista operating system with the latest version of CatalystÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¾Ã‚Â¢.

These include: 
 
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  AVIVO converter may fail to convert h.264 avi video to another format

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Output media file size differs after transcoding multiple times to the same format 

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Both LCD and CRT may go blank when hotplugging the CRT to the system, and will

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  DVD playback may cause the system to stop responding after resume from S3/sleep 

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Frames may be dropped when playing Blu-ray video with PowerDVD8

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Call of Duty 5: Some corruption may be visible 

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Audio Control Panel might not reflect configuration change from 7.1 Audio to Stereo

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Catalyst Control Center: On "Available Display Devices" detection page, when

Known Issues Under the Windows 7 Operating System 
 
The following section provides a summary of open issues that may be experienced under the Windows 7 operating system in the latest version of CatalystÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¾Ã‚Â¢.
These include: 



ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Moving a video clip file across an extended desktop may causes Windows Media

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Display configuration changes in extended desktop may take longer than normal to

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢  Avivo Video Converter option is not available for Windows 7
